poem:
**Storm Bert**

Snow drifts,  
ice grips—  
the roads gridlocked,  
a hush  
in the hum of planes grounded.  

Bert brews in gusts,  
unspools to touch  
homes, dimmed—  

the trees hold  
their breath, limbs  
etched against a sky  
that watches,  
waits—  
in its clenched fist,  
still more to come.
